messages.messageBody:
Thanks Barda,

You are one of the only folks on here to offer me any encouragement. . If I
say something "wrong" it gets nit picked to death.. I beleive you are the
pnly person who has replied to me in a positve way. Thanks again

Teresa

messages.subject: Re: teen yahoo group ( Prejudice)
messages.msgSnippet: I am not, and have never claimed to be an unschooling expert  I know very little about unschooling. Teresa, I m one of many lurker s who from time to time
messages.messageBody:
I am not, and have never claimed to be an unschooling "expert" I know very
little about unschooling.

Teresa,
I'm one of many lurker's who from time to time pop up to put my two cents
in. Not having followed this thread I'm only speaking from what I'm reading
now, You.



And, if I do choose to practice unschooling, I am sure it will be my own
unique style and
approach. Heck, the only thing I can say I am an expert at is raising MY
children. I am a very unstructured, relaxed, easy going parent.

IMHO, you have all the "Credentials" for practicing unschooling.

I know I wont be in a strict schedule with lots of "work" and records. If i
wanted
that, I would keep my children in public school. I do know this. No two
children are alike, no two parents are alike. no two situations are alike.
No method or approach works the same with every child and/or parent.
Because someone chooses a different path than me does not make me superior
to
them, it only makes us different. I do not feel threatened by others
choices. I can respect and learn from others in all walks of life.
Christians, Pagans, Catholics, ( ANY religion actually) UNschoolers,
"structured" homeschoolers, familes of "regular" PS'ers, one is no better
than the other in my eyes. Ultimately, we are all just parents trying to do
whats best for our children

Teresa

Very well said!

Peace and Love in all of the above,

Barda
--
"Shipping" is My Business -

I just got back home from my House Special at The General Mercantile.

The Merc makes coffee the slow way, using a 1950's
Italian
LaPavoni Espresso Machine.

My House Special is alot like "Shipping" . It is slow...

I wouldn't want it any other way.

What is the "Shipping" Business?

RelationShip,
FriendShip,
PartnerShip,
LeaderShip


Curious? Want to know more?


Who is this Barda Allen?
http://www.greatestnetworker.com/is/barda_a_allen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: teen yahoo group ( Prejudice)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/23/02 4:29:10 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Prejudice is a negative cultural attitude, directed against an individual or a group of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/23/02 4:29:10 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> Is this news to you? If so, maybe you don't know enough about unschooling
> yet to be discussing who has what prejudice.
>

"Prejudice is a negative cultural attitude, directed against an individual or
a group of people, that is based on stereotypes. The term comes from the word
"prejudge," which means to judge without sufficient information or
knowledge."

I am not, and have never claimed to be an unschooling "expert" I know very
little about unschooling. Yes, i am interested in learning, but my learning
about the subject does not necessarily mean I will practice it.. And, if I do
choose to practice unschooling, I am sure it will be my own unique style and
approach. Heck, the only thing I can say I am an expert at is raising MY
children. I am a very unstructured, relaxed, easy going parent. I know I
wont be in a strict schedule with lots of "work" and records. If i wanted
that, I would keep my children in public school. I do know this. No two
children are alike, no two parents are alike. no two situations are alike.
No method or approach works the same with every child and/or parent.
Because someone chooses a different path than me does not make me superior to
them, it only makes us different. I do not feel threatened by others
choices. I can respect and learn from others in all walks of life.
Christians, Pagans, Catholics, ( ANY religion actually) UNschoolers,
"structured" homeschoolers, familes of "regular" PS'ers, one is no better
than the other in my eyes. Ultimately, we are all just parents trying to do
whats best for our children

Teresa
